title: Arsene Wenger must be banned for shoving fourth official, insists ex-ref Graham Poll
text:
Arsene Wenger clashes with fourth official Anthony Taylor (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Former Premier League referee Graham Poll insists Arsene Wenger must be handed a lengthy touchline ban after his controversial shove on a fourth official. 
The Arsenal boss was sent off by referee Jon Moss after the Frenchman's rage boiled over when Burnley were handed a late, stoppage-time penalty to equalise. 
Wenger pushed fourth official Anthony Taylor twice when he was asked to leave the tunnel area and had to be moved on by stewards. 
The Arsenal boss has since apologised over the incident with Alexis Sanchez's penalty in the eighth minute of added time earning his title-chasing side a precious 2-1 win. 
The apology was accepted by the match officials, although the matter will be highlighted in the referees match report that could land Wenger in hot water. Wenger shoved Taylor in the tunnel (Photo: Sky Sports) Read More Arsene Wenger apologises for arguing with fourth official 
But Poll is not convinced that is enough and has called for the 61-year-old to be punished with a lengthy ban. 
"Arsene Wenger must surely face a lengthy touchline ban after he inexplicably went berserk and shoved fourth official Anthony Taylor," wrote ex-World Cup official Poll in the Daily Mail . 
"Wenger was asked to leave the technical area, which the Arsenal manager reluctantly did but then tried staying in the tunnel, something he is not permitted to do. Taylor advised him to move, at which point Wenger lost it and appeared to shove the official." 
"Wenger and his team have benefited from plenty of 'close calls' by officials this season and he should have remembered that and stayed calm." Granit Xhaka was sent off in Arsenal's win (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Watch Arsene Wenger react like a guilty school boy 
Wenger could indeed face a noticeable ban. When Paul Ince was in charge of Blackpool in 2013, he was handed a five-match stadium ban for shoving a fourth official. 
And Arsenal's discipline problems face further scrutiny after Granit Xhaka was also sent off during Sunday's win over Burnley after a careless lunge on Steven Defour. If Wenger is banned for five games, what games would he miss? 
Jan 28: Southampton, FA Cup fourth-round (a) Jan 31: Watford (h) Feb 11: Hull (h) Feb 25: Southampton (a)
